docs.snippet: Italy, the defending champion, will meet Bulgaria in the opening game of the 1986 World Cup tournament here next May 31, officials determined today in a public drawing.   The Italians will also play Argentina and South Korea in the first round of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Italy, the defending champion, will meet Bulgaria in the opening game of the 1986 World Cup tournament here next May 31, officials determined today in a public drawing. The Italians will also play Argentina and South Korea in the first round of the World Cup, the quadrennial tournament that will be in 12 stadiums in several major Mexican cities from May 31 through June 29. ''We're content with this draw,'' an Italian soccer official said after the drawing. The Italians' strongest challenge during the first round is likely to come from Argentina.

byline.original: By WILLIAM STOCKTON, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: Latin America's leading debtor nations are expected to renew their campaign for lower interest payments when they meet Monday in Montevideo, Uruguay, to analyze the Baker Plan.   According to officials involved in preparing the conference, the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Latin America's leading debtor nations are expected to renew their campaign for lower interest payments when they meet Monday in Montevideo, Uruguay, to analyze the Baker Plan. According to officials involved in preparing the conference, the consensus in the region is that the Reagan Administration's new initiative to ease the three-year-old debt crisis is ''positive but insufficient.'' They said foreign ministers and finance ministers from the 11-nation Cartagena Group would therefore ''build on'' proposals made by Treasury Secretary James A. Baker 3d at the October meeting of the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank in Seoul, South Korea. The Baker Plan calls for structural economic adjustments by 15 heavily indebted nations, including 10 in Latin America, in exchange for $9 billion in extra loans from the World Bank and $20 billion in ''new money'' from commercial banks over three years.

headline.main: BAKER'S DEBT PLAN GETS LATIN SCRUTINY

byline.original: By ALAN RIDING, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: Early in 1984, Crolla, an English fashion design team, showed a collection of flamboyant tapestrylike floral print clothes. Sherlock Holmes might call what happened next the Case of the Cabbage Roses.   The evolution of this single design as it...
docs.lead_paragraph: Early in 1984, Crolla, an English fashion design team, showed a collection of flamboyant tapestrylike floral print clothes. Sherlock Holmes might call what happened next the Case of the Cabbage Roses. The evolution of this single design as it ascended from the streets of London to a Paris runway, then descended to American mall-quality acrylic, illustrates a prevalent but rarely acknowledged fashion phenomenon known in the trade as the knock-off. Knock-off artists ''take a good idea and flog it to death within a season, as opposed to appreciating quality, providing longer life and supporting designers,'' Scott Crolla says. But, as the Case of the Cabbage Roses indicates, some designers and many manufacturers, support themselves by knocking off, or adapting, existing designs.

headline.main: PURLOINED SWEATER: A CASE OF WHO COPIED WHOM FIRST

docs.snippet: Just five years ago, Francisco Villagran Kramer resigned his post as Vice President of Guatemala and fled the country.   ''Death or exile is the fate of those who fight for justice in Guatemala,'' he said at the time.   Today, Mr. Villagran's...
docs.lead_paragraph: Just five years ago, Francisco Villagran Kramer resigned his post as Vice President of Guatemala and fled the country. ''Death or exile is the fate of those who fight for justice in Guatemala,'' he said at the time. Today, Mr. Villagran's apartment in the capital is a gathering place for young activists eager to discuss what the future holds for Guatemalan democracy. He himself is said to be a possible candidate to head the Supreme Court. The military has run Guatemala for more than 30 years, and during that period Guatemalans have suffered some of the harshest repression in Latin America. Tens of thousands of people, many of them Indians descended from Mayan tribes, have died violently. During some periods, street-corner killings of students, businessmen, political organizers, university professors and trade unionists were common.

byline.original: By STEPHEN KINZER, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: Latin America's leading debtor nations today proposed a set of ''emergency measures,'' including new loans and the reduction of interest rates, to permit a resumption of economic growth in the region.   At the same time, they warned that, without...
docs.lead_paragraph: Latin America's leading debtor nations today proposed a set of ''emergency measures,'' including new loans and the reduction of interest rates, to permit a resumption of economic growth in the region. At the same time, they warned that, without relief from current interest payments, they might be forced to limit the transfer of resources abroad in order to avert social and political instability. The decisions came at the end of a two-day conference of foreign and finance ministers of the 11-nation Cartagena Group, called together to prepare a response to a recent United States debt initiative known as the Baker Plan.

headline.main: LATIN AMERICA DEBTORS URGE LOAN RATE CUT

byline.original: By ALAN RIDING, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: The Economy    The House of Representatives approved legislation that would make the most extensive changes in the Federal income tax system in more than 40 years. The crucial vote came on a motion to recommit the bill to committee, a parliamentary...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Economy The House of Representatives approved legislation that would make the most extensive changes in the Federal income tax system in more than 40 years. The crucial vote came on a motion to recommit the bill to committee, a parliamentary way of killing the legislation. It lost, 256 to 171, and the bill was then approved by voice vote, The measure now goes to the Senate. [Page A1.] That body is likely to adopt a tax revision measure of its own next year, but it will probably be more favorable to business than the House bill. [D22.] Housing construction fell 12.2 percent in November, the sharpest drop in six months. Analysts were divided about the reason for the steep decline, which produced an annual rate of 1.55 million units, the lowest pace since April 1983. [D1.]

docs.snippet: A spokesman for the Sinai Peacekeeping Force said today that the decision to suspend a contract with Arrow Air was made after the airline said it would be unable to fulfill its contract to rotate American soldiers from the United States for members...
docs.lead_paragraph: A spokesman for the Sinai Peacekeeping Force said today that the decision to suspend a contract with Arrow Air was made after the airline said it would be unable to fulfill its contract to rotate American soldiers from the United States for members of the force on duty in the Sinai Peninsula. ''We decided to suspend the use of Arrow pending the results of the investigation,'' said the spokesman, David Bridges. ''We have not canceled the contract, we have just suspended it. No final decision has been taken.''

headline.main: ARROW AIR WON BID AFTER U.S. SOUGHT COMPETITION

byline.original: By JOHN TAGLIABUE, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: Momentum toward a resolution of Mexico's re-emergent debt crisis seems to be building. Jesus Silva Herzog, the country's Finance Minister, flew here last week straight from the meeting of the 11-member Catagena Group of Latin debtors in Monevideo,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Momentum toward a resolution of Mexico's re-emergent debt crisis seems to be building. Jesus Silva Herzog, the country's Finance Minister, flew here last week straight from the meeting of the 11-member Catagena Group of Latin debtors in Monevideo, Uruguay, where participants urged their many creditors to cut interest rates.
